name: Investigate Brute Force Attempt
description: Investigates login failures and also identifies other impacted assets that have been victims of the brute force attempts from a particular source of attack

resource.content: Source IP: {{vars.source_ip}} is found to be safe.
Source IP: {{vars.source_ip}} is Internal and therfore benign

step_variables.h_affected_host: {% for i in vars.result.data.results %}      {% set alert_id = vars.request.data.records[0]['@id'] %}  {{ vars.host_list.append([alert_id,i['host']]) }}     {% endfor %}

resource.content: VirusTotal Reports {{vars.source_ip}}  to be Malicious with an aggregated score of {{vars.steps.Get_Source_IP_Reputation.data.aggregate}}

steps.name: Add details of Splunk query to record

resource.content:
Queried Splunk, and found same SourceIP: {{vars.source_ip}} attempted to log in on following {{ vars.steps.Retrieve_Splunk_query_results.data.results | length }} systems

    {% for i in vars.steps.Retrieve_Splunk_query_results.data.results %} {% set system = i['host'] %}
  • {{ system }}
    • {% endfor %}

steps.name: Update Assets records for affected hosts

resource.content: Source IP {{vars.source_ip}} is External

steps.name: Match Source IP in Internal CIDR

resource.content:
In addition, login to following systems were successful:

{% for i in vars.steps.Query_result_for_successful_intrusion.data.results %}

    {% set system = i['host'] %}
  • {{ system }}

{% endfor %}

This is an Indication of Breach

steps.name: Query Splunk for related events for source IP address

params.query: index="securitylogs" sourcetype="linuxlogs" rhost="{{vars.source_ip}}" authentication failure | stats count by host
index="securitylogs" sourcetype="linuxlogs" accepted password {{vars.source_ip}} | stats count by host

resource.content:
Following are details for user {{vars.ad_user}} who attempted to log on {{vars.alert_metadata.ComputerName}}

 
 LDAP Attributes  Value
distinguishedName {{vars.steps.Get_Win_Domain_User_Details.data.entries[0].dn}}
userPrincipalName {{vars.steps.Get_Win_Domain_User_Details.data.entries[0].attributes.userPrincipalName}}
displayName {{vars.steps.Get_Win_Domain_User_Details.data.entries[0].attributes.displayName}}
sAMAccountName {{vars.steps.Get_Win_Domain_User_Details.data.entries[0].attributes.sAMAccountName}}
lastLogon {{vars.steps.Get_Win_Domain_User_Details.data.entries[0].attributes.lastLogon}}

routes.name: Is Malicious IP -> Create Note for Malicious IP
routes.label: Malicious

routes.name: Is Source IP internal -> Copy  of Create Note for Internal IP
routes.label: External

routes.name: Get Win Domain User Details -> Add notes about user
Add successful intrusion details -> Update Assets records for affected hosts1
Update Severity to Critical -> Take action per system operating system
Add details of Splunk query to record -> Query Splunk of successful intrusion
Start Investigation -> Match Source IP in Internal CIDR
Configuration -> Start Investigation
Is Source IP internal -> Copy 1 of Create Note for Safe IP
routes.label: Internal

routes.name: Take action per system operating system -> Get Win Domain User Details
routes.label: Windows

routes.name: Get Source IP Reputation -> Is Malicious IP
Query result for successful intrusion -> Add successful intrusion details
Start -> Attacker Metadata
Take action per system operating system -> Query Splunk for related events for source IP address
routes.label: Linux

routes.name: Is Malicious IP -> Create Note for Safe IP
routes.label: Safe

routes.name: Create Note for Malicious IP -> Update Severity to High
Match Source IP in Internal CIDR -> Is Source IP internal
Query Splunk of successful intrusion -> Query result for successful intrusion
Retrieve Splunk query results -> Add details of Splunk query to record
Create Note for External IP -> Get Source IP Reputation
Query Splunk for related events for source IP address -> Retrieve Splunk query results
